str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To hasten, urge on, desire earnestly. Probably strengthened from pous; to 'speed', i.e. Urge on; by implication, to await eagerly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
Quickness, speed; hastily, immediately. From the same as tachus; a brief space, i.e. in haste.
On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To receive, accept, acknowledge. From para and dechomai; to accept near, i.e. Admit or delight in.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Witness, evidence, testimony, reputation. From martus; evidence given.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
